Roe v Wade sets precedent for trimester determination by states. In practice, first trimester abortions are fairly well protected. Constitutionally, abortions should be protected until the second trimester. Restrictions are set by the states as long as it is not an ‘undue burden’ to women. As of 1977, federal funds cannot be used to pay for abortions unless patient receives Medicaid patient and has a life-endangering pregnancy or pregnancy caused by rape or incest.
